title.value: Sampling-Based Accuracy Testing of Posterior Estimators for General Inference
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper.
title.quote: Sampling-Based Accuracy Testing of Posterior Estimators for General Inference

extractions.description: The paper introduces Tests of Accuracy with Random Points (TARP) as a method to estimate coverage probabilities of generative posterior estimators. It differentiates itself from previous methods by not requiring posterior evaluations. The theoretical foundation and empirical validation through various experiments are provided, including high-dimensional spaces and specific applications like gravitational lensing source reconstruction.

type.justification: The paper presents new methods (TARP), provides theoretical foundations, and validates them through empirical experiments and simulations.
type.quote: We demonstrate the method on a variety of synthetic examples, and show that TARP can be used to test the results of posterior inference analyses in high-dimensional spaces. We also show that our method can detect inaccurate inferences in cases where existing methods fail.

name.justification: The paper primarily addresses the accuracy testing of posterior estimators within the context of Simulation-Based Inference (SBI).
name.quote: Simulation-based inference (SBI, e.g. Cranmer et al., 2020), also known as likelihood-free inference (LFI) or implicit likelihood inference (ILI), has gained significant popularity in recent years.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses generative models for posterior approximation.
name.quote: Generative models, such as Generative Adversarial Networks GANs (Goodfellow et al., 2014), Normalizing Flows (Dinh et al., 2014; Rezende & Mohamed, 2015; Papamakarios et al., 2021), Variational Autoencoders (Kingma & Welling, 2013), and Score-Based/Diffusion Models (Song et al., 2020; Ho et al., 2020; Sohl-Dickstein et al., 2015), are powerful ways to encode approximate posteriors in such settings.

name.justification: The paper's primary focus is on developing methods for accurate posterior estimation.
name.quote: Generative models can be used as an alternative to Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods for conducting posterior inference, both in likelihood-based and simulation-based problems.

name.justification: The paper particularly emphasizes validation of posterior estimators in high-dimensional parameter spaces.
name.quote: Recently there has been substantial interest in applying SBI in high-dimensional parameter spaces.

name.justification: GANs are mentioned as one type of generative model used in the context of posterior estimation.
name.quote: Generative models, such as Generative Adversarial Networks GANs (Goodfellow et al., 2014)...

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not claim to have developed GANs; it uses them as part of the broader category of generative models.
is_contributed.quote: Generative Adversarial Networks GANs (Goodfellow et al., 2014)...

is_executed.justification: The paper does not specify if the models were executed on GPU or CPU.
is_executed.quote: The paper does not specify if the models were executed on GPU or CPU.

is_compared.justification: There is no specific numeric comparison of GANs with other models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: There is no specific numeric comparison of GANs with other models in the paper.
